title: Reading Radiology Imaging Like The Radiologist. (arXiv:2307.05921v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Automated radiology report generation aims to generate radiology reports that contain rich, fine-grained descriptions of radiology imaging. Compared with image captioning in the natural image domain, medical images are very similar to each other, with only minor differences in the occurrence of diseases. Given the importance of these minor differences in the radiology report, it is crucial to encourage the model to focus more on the subtle regions of disease occurrence. Lastly, generating medical image reports involves the challenge of long text generation, which requires more expertise and empirical training in medical knowledge. translated_title: 阅读放射学成像的方式，就像放射科医生一样
translated_abstract: 自动放射学报告生成旨在生成包含放射学成像的丰富、精细描述的放射学报告。与自然图像领域的图像描述相比，医学图像非常相似，仅在疾病发生的细微差异上有所不同。鉴于这些细微差异在放射学报告中的重要性，鼓励模型更加关注疾病发生的微妙区域至关重要。其次，视觉和文本数据偏差的问题很严重。不仅正常病例占数据集的大部分，还描绘有病变区域的句子只占段落的一小部分。最后，生成医学图像报告涉及到长文本的生成挑战，这需要更多医学知识的专业性和经验训练。因此，生成此类报告的难度增加。为了解决这些挑战，我们提出了一种以疾病为导向的方法。
tldr: 提出一种以疾病为导向的方法，解决自动放射学报告生成中的细微差异关注、数据偏差和长文本生成的挑战。
en_tdlr: A disease-oriented approach is proposed to address the challenges of subtle difference focus, data biases, and long text generation in automated radiology report generation.
